summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting the creation of video clips from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos for the Epstein investigation. It references specific Q&A sequences and provides technical details for accessing the source videos.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her deposition videos are the subject of the email; clips are to be created from her testimony for use in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, requesting the creation of video clips from Maxwell's deposition for the investigation.

connections.person2: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is requesting evidence (video clips) from Maxwell's deposition for the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Request for Deposition Video Clips
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails a request to have specific Q&A sequences from Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos clipped for use in the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: Wisa.doj.gov\cloud NYS StAndrews\Shared\USvEpstein-2018801618 InvestigationVi 2018 SDNY investigation\Subpoena Re a 2o2co - 2, third subpoena response Videos
keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively working with Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition videos as part of the Epstein investigation in May 2020.
The request specifies creating clips from approximately 11 question and answer sequences from Maxwell's depositions.
The source videos were stored on a Department of Justice cloud server, indicating official handling of evidence.
The email demonstrates the procedural step of preparing evidence (video clips) for use in the legal case.
